channel.title: [PI] Some monsters drop summoning charms instead of whats on my NPCDrops.TSM
channel.description: I added this somewhere in my NPCDrops.TSM folder: [code]#Bouncer 269:100(tab)22478:1(tab)275:1[/code] (the (tabs) are because I can't put tabs on this post for some reason, but they mean what they say; tabs) Anyways, I ran with no errors. I tried killing the monster I put the drop tables in for, and still I either got nothing or charms. Other monsters that were pre-added into the drop table drop items from their drop table just fine, and I'm guessing its from an exception on which monsters drop charms. If i'm right, and it is an exception, where can I find this exception and add the npc id's I need to add into the list?

item.title: [PI] Some monsters drop summoning charms instead of whats on my NPCDrops.TSM
item.dc:creator: @tztk tztk
item.description:
@tztk wrote:

James-RevolutionX:

NpcConstants.cfg. Npc ID - Item constantly dropped.

I added some code into that file and My monster has drops now, but how can I make the monster drop multiple of the same stackable item without doing this?

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Some monsters drop summoning charms instead of whats on my NPCDrops.TSM

item.title: [PI] Some monsters drop summoning charms instead of whats on my NPCDrops.TSM
item.dc:creator: @Say_wut Say wut?
item.description:
@Say_wut wrote:

[quote=“tztk, post:1, topic:404555”]I added this somewhere in my NPCDrops.TSM folder:

#Bouncer 269:100(tab)22478:1(tab)275:1
(the (tabs) are because I can’t put tabs on this post for some reason, but they mean what they say; tabs)
Anyways, I ran with no errors. I tried killing the monster I put the drop tables in for, and still I either got nothing or charms. Other monsters that were pre-added into the drop table drop items from their drop table just fine, and I’m guessing its from an exception on which monsters drop charms. If i’m right, and it is an exception, where can I find this exception and add the npc id’s I need to add into the list?[/quote]
This ain’t an exception rofl.
It just ain’t that common, because you’ve set the drop 1 \ 100

Read full topic
